name: Sound effects
description: Last spring, the BBC published an archive of 16,000+ sound effects, licensed for personal, educational or research purposes.
author: BBC

name: Fiscal crises
description: Researchers at the International Monetary Fund have built a historical database of fiscal crises, defined as “periods of extreme fiscal distress, when governments have not been able to contain large fiscal imbalances leading to the adoption of extreme measures"
author: International Monetary Fund

name: Dual citizenship policies
description: If you decide to acquire a new citizenship, do you get to keep your previous one? Are you allowed to renounce it? The Maastricht Center for Citizenship, Migration and Development’s Global Expatriate Dual Citizenship Dataset tracks how 200 countries have, each year since 1960, treated this situation.
author: Maastricht University

name: From Spanskgrøn to Østerland
description: Norse World is an “online, open access searchable index and mapping of the foreign place names found in medieval East Norse texts.”
author: Uppsala Niversitet

name: Cities CO2 emissions
description: An international team of researchers has created a dataset of 343 cities’ CO2 emissions.
author: Pangaea

name: Cabinet turnover
description: Dataset of the last seven presidents cabinets
author: FiveThirtyEight

name: DC taxi rides
description: Taxi trip data from 2015 to 2017 in DC
author: Open Data DC

name: Political conditions
description: Dataset describes political conditions in every country each and every month.
author: OEF Research

name: Protests in autocracies
description: Political protests in autocratic countries
author: Nils B. Weidmann

name: Public pension plans
description: Detailed financial data on state and local public pension plans from Boston.
author: PPD

name: Bird-building collisions
description: To study the relationship between artificial light and “flight calling” among nocturnally-migrating species.
author: DRYAD

name: Autocracies
description: Dataset from nearly 500 parties in more than 150 countries between 1940 and 2015
author: Michael K. Miller

name: Biomedical citations
description: 420 million academic citations in biomedical literature
author: The National Institutes of Health

name: Adoptable dogs
description: All adoptable dogs at shelters and organizations on a single day in September 2019
author: The Pudding

name: Charts and minds
description: The Data Visualization Society has published the results of its annual community survey, which received 1,359 responses from data visualization practitioners.
author: Data Visualization Society

name: Millions of violent crimes
description: Raw data on 4.3 million murders, nonfatal shootnigs, assaults, robberies, and rapes.
author: The Trace and Buzzfeed News

name: Online news language, updated live
description: The dataset keeps track the frequency individual words and two-word in online news around the world.
author: The GDELT Project

name: Interwar debt.
description: A “comprehensive instrument-level database of sovereign debt for 18 advanced and emerging countries over the period 1913–46.”
author: International Monetary Fund

name: Food flows
description: Commodity flow food survey
author: USA Census Bureau

name: Perceived vs. real ages.
description: Dataset of photographs used to guess people ages
author: AgeGuess.org

name: Chicago prosecutions
description: Detailed data on every felony case since 2010 in Cook County
author: Cook County State Attorney Office

name: Electricity prices
description: Dataset with commercial, industrial, and street-lighting electricity from thousands of US utility companies.
author: OpenEI

name: Financial well-being
description: Survey of Income and Program Participation
author: USA Census Bureau

name: Football(soccer)  play-by-play
description: Largest collection of soccer-logs.
author: Unknown (group of academics)

name: Central Park squirrels
description: Dataset with each squirrel location, fur color, behavior, and more in Central Park.
author: Squirrel Census

name: UN blue helmet
description: The United Nations publishes data describing its active peacekeeping missions and police and military personnel, plus all peacekeeping fatalities since 1948.
author: United Nations

name: Earthquakes in Mexico
description: Catalog with more than 5000 eartquakes in Mexico
author: Springer Nature

name: Seized Greek real estate
description: Collected data on properties up for bidding through eauction.gr .
author: Sotiris Sideris

name: Bollywood
description: The Indian Movie Database with more than 4700 movies released between 1950 and 2019.
author: Parth Parikh

name: The kids these days — and four decades ago
description: Monitoring the Future surveys approximately 50,000 eighth-, tenth-, and twelfth-grade students in the U.S. each year.
author: NAHDAP

name: FiveThirtyEight checks its work
description: Thousands of FiveThirtyEights predictions about sports and politics(and their outcomes).
author: FiveThirtyEight

name: Euro-bank speeches
description: ECB has begun publishing a spreadsheet of all executive board members speeches since the late 1990s.
author: ECB

name: Medieval monasteries
description: Dataset that describes the locations and operating years of more than 3000 Cistercian and Franciscan monasteries in 90 european regions between the years 1000 and 1600.
author: Serra Boranbay-Akan and Carmine Guerriero

name: Income inequality around the world, over time
description: Annual Gini coefficients for 196 countries and territories. For many, the calculations go back to the 1960s.
author: Frederick Solt

name: Ambassadorial qualifications
description: Report on the demonstrated "competence" for each ambassadorial nominee that the government held secret.
author: Ryan Scoville

name: Samoas measles outbreak
description: Dataset with a collections of tweets that counts the number of cases and deaths because of measles.
author: Chris von Csefalvay

name: British Isle bumps
description: The Database of British and Irish Hills began 20 years ago and now catalogs more than 20,000 bits of bumpy terrain. The data files include detailed coordinates, map references, and descriptive characteristics.
author: The Database of British and Irish Hills

name: Death row
description: Comprehensive dataset on everyone sentenced to die in active death penalty jurisdictions since 1976.
author: The Intercept

name: Spelling fixes
description: The GitHub Typo Corpus contains structured data on misspellings, bad grammar, and the ways they have been corrected.
author: Masato Hagiwara and Masato Mita

name: Book ratings
description: Dataset with 433,000 numeric ratings of 186,000 books by 78,000 users on the book-tracking website BookCrossing.
author: Cai-Nicolas Ziegler

name: Yearbook photos
description: The rise and fall of big hair from 37,921 portraits culled from the yearbooks of 115 American high schools in 26 states between 1905 and 2013.
author: Elle OBrien and Jan Diehm

name: Missing migrants
description: This dataset tracks deaths of migrants, including refugees and asylum-seekers, who have gone missing along mixed migration routes worldwide.
author: International Organization for Migration

name: Microorganisms
description: The Microbe Directory is an attempt to profile more than 7,000 bacteria, viruses, archaea, and other microorganisms.
author: The Microbe Directory

name: Geographic (re)naming proposals
description: Dataset with proposal names for a geographic feature of the USA.
author: USGS

name: The life of a supercomputer
description: The dataset contains records of the supercomputer entire lifetime with metada of their computing jobs, timestamps,memory usage, and more.
author: CIEMAT

name: Street sprawl
description: Systematic and globally commensurable measures of street-network sprawl based on graph-theoretic and geographic concepts.
author: Christopher Barrington-Leigh and Adam Millard-Ball

name: Cannabis tests
description: Dataset from Washington state containing measurements of the cannabinoid content of legal cannabis products from state-certified laboratories.
author: Nick Jikomes and Michael Zoorob

name: How we spend our time
description: Dataset from the American Time Use Survey with measurements on how we spend sleeping, eating, and working since 2003.
author: U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics

name: Dams
description: The Global Georeferenced Database of Dams contains geographic data on more than 38,000 dams and their watersheds.
author: Global Georeferenced Database of Dams

name: Three decades of Spanish migration
description: Annual microdata on the relocation of residents within, into, and out of the country.
author: El Confidencial

name: Darknet market survival
description: The researcher who goes by “Gwern” maintains a dataset of more than 80 darknet marketplaces founded between 2011 and 2015. For each market (such as the infamous Silk Road), the dataset lists when it began, when it closed, why it closed, its URL, what cryptocurrencies it accepted, whether guns were allowed to be sold, and more.
author: Gwern

name: California vanity plates
description: Data on more than 23,000 personalized license plate applications flagged for review by the California DMV.
author: Noah Veltman

name: Credibly accused clergy
description: Reporters at ProPublica have assembled the first-ever nationwide database of US Catholic clergy “credibly accused” of sexual abuse, based on nearly 180 official lists released by dioceses and religious orders.
author: ProPublica

name: Coronavirus cases
description: As the Wuhan coronavirus outbreak intensifies, a team at Johns Hopkins has been mapping the number of confirmed cases, deaths, and recoveries.
author: Johns Hopkins

name: Baseball sign-stealing
description: Dataset of the stealing signs of the Houston Astros
author: Tony Adams

name: Hotel bookings
description: Dataset detailing nearly 120,000 (anonymized) bookings at two (unnamed) hotels in Portugal between July 2015 and August 2017.
author: Instituto Universitário de Lisboa

name: Last (but not least) names
description: From the US Census Bureau, you can download a dataset of all surnames that belonged to at least 100 people in 2010, and the same for 2000
author: US Census Bureau

name: Banking crises
description: Dataset of systemic banking crises
author: Luc Laeven and Fabián Valencia

name: Europe in translation
description: European Unions official terminology database, containing translations for words and phrases such as “orange juice,” “climate change policy”, and “competence of the Member States.”
author: IATE

name: Tropical cyclone simulations
description: A team of scientists have used historical hurricane and typhoon data to simulate a 10,000 plausible years of cyclone activity.
author: Unknown

name: arXiv metadata
description: Open-access repository of more than 1,600,000 scholarly articles
author: arXiv

name: Backyard ice rinks
description: The project downloadable data includes more than 30,000 “skateable” / “not skateable”.
author: RinkWatch

name: Biggie data
description: What are the greatest hip-hop songs of all time? Last year, the BBC posed that question to more than 100 artists, producers, critics, and other experts, asking each to rank their top five tracks.
author: BBC and Simon Jockers

name: COVID-19 cases, continued
description: A COVID-19 dashboard and daily-updated data files tracking country-level cases and deaths.
author: The European Centre for Disease Prevention and Control

name: Official coronavirus interventions
description: ACAPS, a humanitarian analysis nonprofit, is cataloguing government measures implemented in response to the pandemic.
author: ACAPS

name: Prisoners, polled
description: Survey of incarcerated people’s political views
author: The Marshall Project and Slate

name: Unfinished business
description: BusinessFinancing.co.uk attempted to identify the oldest, still-operating companies in every country in the world,
author: BusinessFinancing.co.uk

name: Subnational COVID-19 case counts
description: The New York Times is conducting “a round-the-clock effort to tally every known coronavirus case in the United States,” and has begun publishing a dataset of county-level cases and deaths
author: NYT

name: iPhone search warrants
description: The database, published last month, includes court-docket information, the requesting agency, the suspected crimes, phone models, and more.
author: Colin Prince

name: Before Wikipedia
description: The National Library of Scotland has digitized the first eight editions of the Encyclopaedia Britannica, issued between 1768 and 1860.
author: National Library of Scotland

name: Oklahoma prisioners
description: A decades worth of state prison data never before analyzed by the state itself.
author: Reveal
